attributes.action: Make Blue Badges Available to People With Mental Health Conditions.
attributes.background:
Under current regulations mental health conditions such as agoraphobia, anxiety and panic disorder are not accepted as valid reasons for needing a Blue Badge.
These conditions can be equally and sometimes more debilitating than a physical disability and it is discriminatory to exclude them.
attributes.additional_details:
Blue Badges, which allow people with certain disabilities to park closer to services, are only available to those with a physical disability. Those suffering from the above conditions are not able to apply for a badge unless they receive the higher rate of the mobility component of DLA.
The exception is if a person is unable to follow a familiar route without aid.
Mental health conditions can affect mobility and be extremely disabling, preventing a full life. Blue Badges could help with this.

attributes.action: Call a UK referendum on what our new relationship with Europe should be.
attributes.background:
A referendum is now required to clarify the position of the people of the UK with regards the pending  negotiation of the UK's future relationship with the EU. An outline proposal 
1: Tariff-based trade as non EEA member
2: EEA membership subject to EU rules
3: Full EU membership

attributes.action: Schools to have the funding for a full time teaching assistant in every class.
attributes.background: To ensure that every child is supported in their education, every primary school should have the funding to employ a full time teaching assistant in every class. This would not be to fulfil administrative tasks but to support the learning of all children.

attributes.action: Give all teenagers aged under 18 on 23.6.16 a vote in a supplemental referendum.
attributes.background: Allowing teenagers to vote in a supplementary EU referendum will be good for the future of Britain’s democracy, because whatever the final outcome they will have had the opportunity to participate in the decision. Their votes can be added to the June ballot and the result recalculated.

attributes.action: Nationally standardise the colours of commercial and domestic rubbish bins.
attributes.background: Each council area has a different colour scheme for rubbish and recycling bins. This often adds to confusion over what can be recycled, and recyclable waste is often thrown away, or recyclable materials are often put in the incorrect bins.
attributes.additional_details:
The colour scheme would become second nature to people's views towards waste disposal. The colour scheme could even extend to public litter bins on the streets.

Whilst this process could take some time, it could be implemented in a phased way, as and when bins are scheduled for routine replacement.

attributes.action: End Taxpayer Bail-outs of Banks by removing limitation of shareholder liability.
attributes.background: Between 2007 and 2010 the British Taxpayer bailed out the banks and bankers with cash and guarantees totalling £1,162 BILLION, equivalent to almost 3 times the total NHS budget for the same 4-year period! (Source: NAO; https://www.nao.org.uk/highlights/taxpayer-support-for-uk-banks-faqs/)
attributes.additional_details: The remedy is to ensure that shareholders are on the hook for all the banks' liabilities without a taxpayer safety net. They will then hold bank directors and management to account and monitor risk to prevent recurrences of such disasters. To achieve this, Parliament should remove shareholders' limited liability in banks (and any other business deemed too big to fail), so that shareholders, not taxpayers, are liable for all the banks' liabilities. There can be no reasonable objection to this.

attributes.action: Lower the Income Requirement for Spouse/Family Visas to UK from non EU Countries
attributes.background: The current income requirement for British citizens to bring their non-EU spouses to the UK is £18,600. According to the BBC, 50% of British Citizens do not earn enough to meet the new requirements. Britons earning minimum wage should have the right to a family. by basic human rights.
attributes.additional_details:
The High Courts suggested £13,000 ,above National Minimum Wage.Which, is being appealed by the Home Office as too low. Members of the EU with non-EU spouses aren't subjected to the same requirement. British citizens should not be punished for who they want to marry. 
The HS, Theresa May, said 'these current laws openly discriminate against the poor'.
Propose lowering the income requirement so that citizens working full-time(40 hours)on a minimum wage salary can be with their Spouses.

attributes.action: Pass a law prohibiting or limiting referendums
attributes.background:
Parliament should pass a law either prohibiting referendums or requiring that the result that would change the status quo would need to achieve more than two-thirds of the votes cast to pass.

The current EU referendum demonstrates that too often they are - disruptive, divisive and distracting.
attributes.additional_details:
We live in a representative democracy. It is important that people have a say in their own government but it is equally important that we avoid a tyranny of the majority and that on particular issues voting proceeds on the basis of knowledge and understanding. Representative democracy, for all its flaws, achieves that goal better than any referendum can.

Meanwhile the referendum process distracts from other issues, falsely turns complex questions into binary choices and fosters division.

attributes.action: Give domiciliary carers car maintenance funds per year.
attributes.background: I am carer in the community and my wages just about cover fuel and bills. I love my job but many of us carers cant pay for the wear and tear, that the daily usage is damaging our cars, by using it for up to 12hrs a day.
attributes.additional_details: I have found no extra help of funding/loans to help me get my car fixed and risk loosing my job

attributes.action: Make Grooming awareness classes compulsory in year 7 students timetables.
attributes.background: Grooming Gangs target young and vulnerable children.  This is more evident as the scandals are hitting the media headlines, like in Rotherham where 1400 girls were sexually exploited. Ever since more cases have come to light.  Young people need to be educated regarding this ongoing problem.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rotherham_child_sexual_exploitation_scandal

attributes.action: Change the law to clarify election expenses and end the current controversy.
attributes.background:
The government should end the current controversy over allegations of electoral fraud by changing the law such that the rules are made unambiguous.
If the party in question apologises for the mistake and the affected members step down there should be no need for expensive investigations.
attributes.additional_details:
Either this issue stems from an honest mistake or it does not.
If it is an honest mistake then the only reasonable course of action is to own up and try to set it straight.
If it is not an honest mistake, then it appears to be a callous and calculated plot perpetrated by a corruption that runs through the heart of the party.

attributes.action: Increased pay for nurses, support workers and doctors in the NHS of 20% minimum
attributes.background: Last summer I was admitted to an adolescent psychiatric ward. My admission went on to last eight months and I have made tremendous progress in ways that I couldn't have foreseen in those first few days and months but I couldn't have done it without the incredible support network off staff!
attributes.additional_details: Less than a year on,i'm in college and aim to be back in full time education in September. I also have a part time job and I'm now providing for myself at 16 years of age. I am amazed at how the staff always responded calmly to fellow patients regardless of how much we might have tested their patience. I am inspired by their ability to stay calm in stressful situations. I appreciate the long and hard hours they put in to ensure other people's well being for a ridiculous excuse of a salary.

attributes.action: Introduce a minimum speed limit of 100mph in the fast lane of the UK motorway.
attributes.background: Minimum speed limit of 100mph in the fast overtaking lane on UK motorways could cut down on accidents that result in serious injuries or even death.
attributes.additional_details:
Statistics show most accidents on the motorway occur in slow moving traffic.

By introducing a minimum speed limit of 100mph in the fast lane on UK motorways could cut down on accidents. This could save millions of pounds annually.

Enforcement: A speed camera that is programmed to catch out motorists driving below 100mph in the fast lane on UK motorways.

Punishment: 3 penalty points and a £100 fine or a short driving test to test their ability to see if they can drive safely at atleast 100mph in the fast lane.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to set up camp on public or private land without permission
attributes.background: In Newport gypsies set up camp with 14 caravans and an array of luxury cars including two Mercedes, a BMW X6, and a Volkswagen, blocked hundreds of NHS staff from parking outside the hospital. Hospital spokesman Ms Hayman said legal advice was sought over how to eject them.
attributes.additional_details:
Can gypsies and travellers occupy any seemingly vacant land?
No, as mentioned above, they cannot simply occupy land because it is vacant, if it has not been designated for this purpose.
Gypsies or travellers should contact the local authority in the area in which they wish to camp to find out whether there is any space for them on a permanent, or temporary site.

attributes.action: Make schools provide more support for left handed children learning to write
attributes.background: Schools are equipped for right handed children. Items such as workbooks are not helpful. At such an important time in their development, not having specific support can knock their confidence. For example work books set out so that their writing hand is not covering the words they are copying.
attributes.additional_details: I have two left handed children and a left handed brother.  They struggle to use simple things because they live in a right handed world.

attributes.action: Change war pension deductions to benefits
attributes.background: Soldiers/veterans injured receive say £71.00 per week and claims ESA the DWP only allow £10 and take the rest away. This is compensation given due to injury and to have it removed when others on DLA are not effected or those on Universal Credits are not effected but those still on ESA suffer.
attributes.additional_details:
To The Rt Hon Stephan Crabb MP
 I would like to have the inconsistencies addressed for war disablement pension to be disregarded altogether as income as this is compensation awarded to the injured party and not a standard pension or income. All these issues have been addressed under the new universal credit scheme and is now left to a 'postcode lottery' as to whether our war veterans are put in hardship or not.

attributes.action: Change to (CCRs) Regulations 2013 to an prevent online fraud
attributes.background: There is loop hole being exploited by a small number of online buyers, where if the seller cannot prove delivery (ie sent WITHOUT ONLINE TRACKING) the buyer claims non-delivery getting money back and the goods (theft). This is costing traders a small fortune in claims.
attributes.additional_details: What I propose is if the seller offers a tracking service and the buyer declines that service, then the risk should pass from the seller to the buyer (PROVIDING THE SELLER CAN PROVE DISPATCH. ie Royal Mail Certificate of posting) and no claims will be accepted for non-delivery. This will make no difference for goods damaged in transit claims.

attributes.action: Stop 39 week waiting period for mortgage interest payments
attributes.background:
From 1/04/16 the government has implemented a 39 week waiting period for mortgage interest payment support. 
This means that people like myself who have always worked and paid into the system but now can not work through no fault of their own such as cancer risk losing their property
attributes.additional_details:
From 1 April 2016 the waiting period until you receive any payment will increase from 13 to 39 weeks for new claims.Reference DWP website
Support for Mortgage Interest (SMI) https://www.gov.uk/support-for-mortgage-interest/overview

attributes.action: Extra bank holiday for the Queen's birthday as we had an extra day in February.
attributes.background: As we had an extra day in February, I think we should get an extra bank holiday to help celebrate the Queens birthday on the 10th of June.

attributes.action: Allow transgendered people to begin hormone treatment from the age of 16.
attributes.background: Many people realise they are transgender in the early stages of their life but aren't allowed to begging transitioning into the opposite gender until the age of 18.

attributes.action: Allow parents to supervise a child fishing without having to purchase a licence.
attributes.background: The current rules for fishing licence is that a child under 12 needs doesn't need a licence but if they of a young age and require help holding a rod the person helping has to have a licence or they can face a £2000 fine

attributes.action: Increase the number of physiotherapists in the NHS.
attributes.background:
Waiting times from a GP referral vary from 2 weeks to 3 months or more.
Prompter physiotherapy would:
1. Increase patient mobility, strength, coordination, confidence and well-being.
2. Prevent deterioration or accidents, thereby reducing treatment costs.
3. Reduce pressure on GPs and hospitals.

attributes.action: Tax "junk foods", & give the money to Companies who produce healthy products.
attributes.background: What we eat has a detrimental affect on our physical and mental health & the wrong decisions are costing the NHS money. People need incentive to eat a balanced diet & the price difference isn't helping.
attributes.additional_details:
BBC news reported that Poor diet 'costs NHS £6bn a year'
Jamie oliver saw an increase in grades and a reduction "authorised absences" — which are generally due to illness – fell by 15% after his 2004 Feed Me Better campaign,
Researchers describe one survey which found that 39% of people rated price as the most important factor in their food choice compared to just 9% who considered a food’s healthiness to be most important. Thursday October 9 2014, NHS choices.

attributes.action: Increase Police funding to proactively tackle driveway car thefts.
attributes.background: Everyday you read about someone who has had their car stolen from their driveway. Police numbers have reduced to merely providing a reactive approach to this. Having your vehicle stolen is in inconvenient and unfair. We, (You) deserve better. Sign now to get this debated and funding increased.

attributes.action: Help more young people and Adults with Autism into Employment.
attributes.background: I have a autistic spectrum condition and I have managed with support into gradual full time employment. Just because we have Autism doesn't make us incapable or means we can't work like any other person.

attributes.action: Video all pip and esa assessments
attributes.background: There seems to be so many stories that atos, capita and other assessment companies are causing benefits to be stopped because of their lies... if they are video recorded then each party is completely backed up

attributes.action: Benefits paid onto a government photo ID which limits what can be purchased.
attributes.background:
Sign this so that tax payers benefits are not spent on holidays, cigarettes, drugs, alcohol or sky TV etc.  
Benefits should not pay for luxuries or for people to go out socialisng and buying items working people consider luxury and difficult to afford.
attributes.additional_details:
People on benefits need support to live but they should not be able to spend this tax payers support on items working class people struggle to afford.  Shops would be limited in the items they can sell and prosecuted if they sell alcohol, cigarettes, lottery tickets, holidays etc. 
Pre-loaded cards should be in  the form of photo ID and a database to have the ability to store the bar codes of items purchased as a way for debt advisors to support budgeting if required.

attributes.action: Bring the unaccompanied minors and others in the refugee camp in Calais to UK
attributes.background: To ask the Home Office to issue humanitarian visas to all those in the Calais camp (and the smaller number in Dunkerque) and arrange safe transport to Britain. As a priority, the unaccompanied minors should be brought to Britain as per the Dubs amendment.
attributes.additional_details: Two weeks ago, I went on a six day visit to the camp, having taken some aid for children and others and spent time with the people in the camp. There are businesses set up by inhabitants of the camp, some semblance of normality in an abnormal situation. There are schools, cafes and drop-in centres for the young. But the French authorities seem hell-bent on destroying such necessary amenities.  It is harassment of the most vulnerable people. Give these people the right to settle in UK.

attributes.action: Introduce a law for all branded takeaway coffee cups to be easily recycled.
attributes.background:
Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall has alerted us all to the environmental damage that the humble coffee cup can cause. 
See his war on waste program: http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b07m8qwz
If legislation was introduced to force the large coffee chains to act then this problem would quickly disappear.

attributes.action: Reduce the payment of stamp duty to 0% for British Armed Forces personnel
attributes.background:
Armed Forces personnel, by virtue of work, are likely to move around more as a result of posting. Moving home every 2-3 years can be
costly incurring legal fees and tax. To reduce this cost, incured as a result of the employment, stamp duty could be reduced to 0% for residential property purchase
attributes.additional_details: With my current property 2 years on the market at a price below market value and still unable to sell. When I return from serving overseas I will incur 3% stamp duty to buy a new home close to where I work. I face this, paying full rent for a property or living in a single man room where I have little choice over food and little privacy, Im 43 I dont wish to live like a student, I would like to afford my own space.

attributes.action: Extend the 'Aiming High for Young People' Plan
attributes.background: The 'Aiming High for Young People Plan' provides young people with funding and comfort, as well as an escape for troubled kids. Without the appropriate places for young people to stay off the streets, crime has statistically increased in these areas.
attributes.additional_details: By next year, the government will stop providing a place of comfort for young people in every consistentuency, the government will stop providing £25 million for teenagers in disadvantaged communities, and the government will stop providing young people influence over local authority funding. This needs to be changed. We, as gatekeepers for the next generation, must make sure the youth develop with the optimum funding and appreciation. The futures of millions of children holds in the balance.

attributes.action: Stop the spending of £1.9million taxpayers money on a pointless wall in Calais.
attributes.background: The UK government invested over £20million of tax payers money reinforcing UK border security at the port of Calais in 2014. Stop them investing a further £1.9million on a pointless wall.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK government and Calais mayor want to build a 4m high border wall around the ferry port at Calais to the tune of £1.9million of UK tax money. This would drastically affect the safety of refugees trying to cross into the UK who would have to face further devastatingly dangerous situations. The wall would also present the first border wall to be erected in Europe since the Berlin wall.

Please sign this petition if you agree we should be seeking better solutions than building pointless walls.

attributes.action: Ensure UK-EU Brexit deal retains our "passporting" rights in financial services
attributes.background: If we lose passporting rights in financial services due to Brexit it could be very damaging for the UK economy as firms re-locate activities to financial centres in the EU; this key issue has been largely ignored by politicians and this petition gives citizens a voice to help protect our economy

attributes.action: Create a 'silent shopping hour' for autistic people in supermarket chains.
attributes.background: Autism Spectrum Condition is a developmental disorder that affects 700,000 people in the UK from birth. One type of autism is is over/under sensitivity to senses such as hearing, sight and smell. As a result, many autistic people find it very difficult to shop with lots of noise and flashing lights.
attributes.additional_details: An ASDA branch in Manchester ran a trial of a 'quiet hour' for autistic people, in which they turned off bright lights, loud music, and store announcements. This was very highly supported, and autistic people found it incredibly beneficial for them. We are a National Citizen Service group who have learned a lot about this topic recently, and we want more supermarket branches to create a 'silent hour', in order to make life that little bit easier for people with autism.

attributes.action: Change the gambling age to 21+ now!
attributes.background: With more and more gambling sites appearing, new bookies opening daily, and the sponsorships of Gambling companies appearing all over, and around our sport teams stadiums and merchandise. Our younger generation is constantly force fed and reminded of these companies.
attributes.additional_details: With a National Lottery ticket you must be 16+, Any bookies and/or Casino 18+, I feel if we postpone the ability to gamble, this will have massive benefits to the younger generation as they'll have a much better understanding of money and it's worth at the age of 21, as opposed to 16/18. Let's take control of early addiction, and encourage our own self-success.

attributes.action: Make non-payment of rent a criminal offence
attributes.background: Landlords need protection from unscrupulous people who refuse to pay their rent knowing the law is in favour of the tenant. Not only will they  continue to live rent free sometimes for up to a year but they will often trash the property rendering it uninhabitable and then move doing the same again.
attributes.additional_details: Unscrupulous tenants deliberately fail to pay their rent knowing that the legal processes of eviction are long and tedious,They take advantage of this often causing serious damage to a property while the landlord is waiting for legal processes to take effect. These types often cause conflict with neighbours and no-one can take them to task over it. When they are eventually evicted they repeat the process elsewhere  without paying a penny towards their debt or being held accountable for damage.

attributes.action: Ban the use of "committed suicide" by public bodies or in any official context.
attributes.background: My Grandfather ended his own life 11 years ago, for reasons we will never know. My Grandmother never recovered from both finding him after he had passed, but more so the stigma attached to the way in which he died. Suicide isn't a crime, and the term 'committed' should cease to be used in reference.
attributes.additional_details: There was a similar petition to this which recently gained over 2000 signatures, but this has since become inactive due to it being on here for more than six months and failing to obtain 10,000 signatures. I am doing several charity events to raise money for the SOBS charity who help those left behind following death by suicide, and I would like to reignite this petition, gaining enough signatures for this issue to be seen and considered in parliament.

attributes.action: Don't implement GCSE exam 9-1 grades, instead have A*, A, B*, B, C*, C, D, E, F.
attributes.background: The justification for swapping from A*-G to 9-1 can be found on the gov.uk webpage in additional details. After reading it I hope you agree it will just serve to cause massive confusion for employers & students. The system I propose keeps the the new 9 grades but is comparable to existing ones.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/setting-standards-for-new-gcses-in-2017

http://www.theguardian.com/education/2015/jun/02/ofqual-survey-finds-wide-confusion-and-doubts-about-gcse-and-a-level-changes

https://www.tes.com/news/school-news/breaking-news/teachers-confused-over-new-numerical-gcse-grading-system

attributes.action: If Brexit happens. All previous EU spending should be forced to go to the NHS.
attributes.background: The Leave campaign made promises that the money spent in the EU would go to the NHS. They should be forced to up keep that promise.

attributes.action: Hold a vote to find out if the country wants a second EU referendum
attributes.background: The Leave campaign has distanced itself from their pre-referendum statements, has no post referendum plan and many people who voted out have changed their mind. We, the undersigned feel that this would be the only democratic route to gauge opinion and offer a way to unite the country once again.

attributes.action: To revoke the Barnett Formula for Scotland
attributes.background: Scotland has an unfair advantage due to the excessive money given to Scotland by the Barnett Formula. They use this to spend in uncontrolled ways, i.e. Free prescriptions and tuition fees.  This is grossly unfair to the people of England and should be stopped with immediate effect.

attributes.action: All school meals in the UK to be planned and supervised by a nutritionist
attributes.background: Better nutrition for our kids needs to be a priority. Nutrition is the very foundation for a healthy life. Hungry kids tend not to pay attention during class, lack focus and affects their moods.
attributes.additional_details: Example, Finland one of the best education systems in the world, is nutrition part of their success? http://www.oph.fi/download/47657_school_meals_in_finland.pdf

attributes.action: All pledges in democratic elections and referendums should be legally binding.
attributes.background: The recent EU referendum result is based upon a campaign of misinformation.  This is not democratic since the public are not being told the truth. All elections pledges should be clear and legally binding. Any politician found to be deliberately misleading the public should be convicted of fraud.

attributes.action: Hold an EU referendum where it is illegal  to knowingly misrepresent the facts
attributes.background: Many people voted in The EU referendum based on statements which campaign Leaders have admitted were mistakes.  We believe there would have been a different outcome if it was illegal to make false representations to the public and call on the outcome to be set aside and a new referendum to be held

attributes.action: Make future UK referendum results require a majority of 60%
attributes.background: Referendums are called by the UK government on matters of major constitutional change. Any major change from the status quo should have the backing of at least 60% of those who vote in each referendum.
attributes.additional_details: Recent referendums have demonstrated the strongly devisive nature of proposed major changes to people's lives, especially when the result is close to an even split. Having to reach a qualified majority of 60% in any UK referendum would help ensure that changes are more widely accepted amongst the electorate.

attributes.action: Offer British citizenship to Polish nationals resident in the UK on June 23 2016
attributes.background: The Polish people are longstanding & valued friends and allies of the UK, and we have deep ties which exceed and excel any EU links. We hereby petition the UK Government to extend an offer of automatic British Citizenship to all Polish nationals resident in the UK on June 23rd 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
We deeply regret the sense of insult felt by the Polish nation resulting from the referendum decision to leave the EU. We wish to repair our relationship. We wish to recognise the outstanding contribution to peace of the Free Polish Army, and to reassure the UK's widespread, well integrated, Polish-heritage communities, which in many cases pre-date the formation of the EU. 

http://www.bbc.co.uk/history/familyhistory/bloodlines/migration.shtml?entry=polish_free_forces&theme=migration

attributes.action: Reform our parliamentary system in the wake of the UK's vote for independence.
attributes.background: One argument put forward by the Leave campaign was that the EU was undemocratic. This message undoubtedly struck a chord with many voters who feel disenfranchised. Yet Brexit will not solve this since our parliamentary system remains inherently unrepresentative for the following reasons:
attributes.additional_details:
- The House of Lords is unelected.
- First Past the Post is unrepresentative. UKIP (3881129) and Greens (1157613) needed vastly more voters per MP than Labour (40290) or Conservatives (34245) (https://www.opendemocracy.net/ourkingdom/liam-anderson/voters-per-mp-why-first-past-post-failed).

The following should happen before the next election:
- The House of Lords be replaced with an elected Second Chamber.
- A debate (and possible referendum) over the best voting system (PR, STV, AV+, FPTP).

attributes.action: Adjust the status of UK residents on Tier2 ICT visa or cancel it from visa types
attributes.background: The Tier2 ICT visa is a new modern slavery, this visa status takes away all your privileges as a human. You pay equal tax as a UK resident yet because people knows that you can't stay for longer than 5 years there are many things you cant do, in my case: adopt, get a mortgage, change jobs and more
attributes.additional_details: UK government have changed the laws so that everyone who's living in UK for more than 183 days becomes a resident and pay tax, however, people in Tier2 ICT visa status do not get any benefits to the contrary, if they can't find a job outside UK within 5 years they end up paying an equal tax to a resident, stuck in a job they don't want to do (many employers abuse there ICT people because they know they own them), no bank will give you a mortgage because they can't trust what will happen to you in 5 years.

attributes.action: Remove the titles Mrs, Miss and Ms from all government forms.
attributes.background: Titles for women are sexist and discriminatory, and provide marital status information about them that men do not have to divulge. Even having the Ms option gives some people a preconception about that person. All titles fields should be removed from document and computer forms.

attributes.action: Ban letting agents from charging letting fees to renters.
attributes.background: Renters are hit with high costs every time they move. It is time to bring an end to expensive letting fees which are already banned in Scotland and which allow letting agents to unfairly 'double charge' both the landlord and the tenant.
